author: PetSerAl
body: It seems that `dotnet` build process is capable to set all necessary assembly metadata, like version and copyright strings, application icon. Why do we use external utility to do that instead? Is any good reason to use `rcedit` to edit compiled `.exe` rather than set this metadata thru `.csproj` file?

comments.author: thezim
comments.body: See #5178 and its associated issues for the back story. Perhaps this is no longer needed with .Net Core 2.1.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@PetSerAl Do you know that dotnet can assign an icon to exe?
I see that a tracking issue is still open. https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/3267

comments.author: PetSerAl
comments.body: @iSazonov You are right. `dotnet` does not support this when publishing self-contained app for .NET Core runtime.

title: Why do we use rcedit?
